title: The Doors of the Dauphine's Palace: A Collection of Short Stories
description: A simple book acts as a sinister portal to endless horrors. A grief-stricken man reminisces about everything he's lost. A knight is forced to fight to the death in a cruel test of fate. Lives are ruined, sanity destroyed—and nothing is what it truly seems. Exploring the farthest reaches of human darkness, The Doors of the Dauphine's Palace addresses terror, madness, desperation, and loss with a collection of short stories reminiscent of the works of Stephen King and H.P. Lovecraft. In a series of tales ranging from dramatic fiction to fantasy to Lovecraftian horror, barriers are broken and lives destroyed by the increasingly evil powers of a mysterious tome. This faceless terror also acts as the thematic thread connecting several of these memorable stories together. Meanwhile, a prison escape, a failed marriage, and a plane crash set the stage for several of author Ed Kaczynski's other tales, each one reflecting the hellish realities that may lurk within the confines of everyday life—or beyond one's wildest imagination. A compelling collection of stories for fantasy, horror, and short fiction enthusiasts, The Doors of the Dauphine's Palace is a chilling, compulsively readable book and Kaczynski's debut publication.
author: Ed Kaczynski
